system.biography:
TitleFFF 804b Gargu-Kyani Hunter
Birthday13 Ilvin 713
AppearanceAge 6, height 3’8”, medium frame (size 3), weight 83 lb, plain appearance, pallid complexion, yellow-white hair, pale blue eyes.
Medical/PsycheMonochromasia, missing left eye
Size0
ArmorPlain cloth tunic, chainmail byrnie, plate vambraces, and leather cloak; leather belt. Spear.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch (buckram), flint & steel
Valuables31d in silver coin
NotesTypically have the following canine companions: a highly intelligent (08 Int) wolfhound, a harmless old bloodhound, an excitable young Kaldorin sheepdog, a fox missing a rear paw from a trap, an adult male black wolf, and a young female black wolf.

Biography

Gargu-kyani are well known for keeping dogs as companions. Taatulk prefers canines over even those of his own kind and lives apart from his fellow white orcs. To harm a canine in his presence will rouse Taatulk to wrath; to kill a canine will prompt him to seek the offender’s death with no regard to his own life. His companions include wolves, foxes, and even aged hunting dogs with few teeth. It is a testament to Taatulk’s skill that these animals remain at peace with each other. He dotes on his friends with a love and affection that is unique amongst gargun and rare even among humans. The animals love him in return and will fight to the death for him.

Taatulk found early in life that he has an almost mystical affinity with canines. He is able to safely approach and befriend even the most hostile wild wolves. On one fateful day, Taatulk lashed out and killed the king for severely beating a hunting dog over a choice cut of a kill. Taatulk decided to leave his tribe to wander and explore the rugged wilderness of Hârn alone with his steadfast canine friends.

Taatulk favors two things most in life, bear hunting and raiding the livestock of farmsteads. The former ensures he always sports a bear-skin cape and claw necklace. A ruined left eye and lasting scars are the legacy of one such encounter. The latter keeps him and his companions well fed. His skill at raiding farms is legendary. He often gets guard dogs to lie down and quietly wag their tails while he quickly makes off with chickens and lambs in the dark of night. More than once, these same guard dogs have abandoned their human masters to join Taatulk’s four-legged troupe.

HOOKS

A Fox in the Hen House. A manor lord is at his wits’ end trying to capture an unknown animal raiding livestock. The lord’s hounds, the best in the hundred, are unable to track the scent, and guard dogs are disappearing without a trace. The lord hires the PCs to capture what he thinks is an especially crafty fox or wolf.

The Hunter and the Hunted. The PCs are being tracked by a very large and very hungry bear that is, in turn, being hunted by Taatulk and his hounds. Taatulk will honor PCs who slay the bear with a token of silver if they handle themselves well.

A Friend in Need is a Friend Indeed. The PCs come across a wolf in a trap. Taatulk and his friends are close by, forced to hide from the PCs before he could free the wolf. Freeing the wolf will prompt Taatulk to approach the PCs with offers of respect and gratitude. Slaying the wolf while it is trapped will rouse Taatulk to avenge the wolf’s death.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Part 13” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/fff-gargu/), by Shawn Bond, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
